# ZeroWiki Issues

## Bugs
+ Don't work with special chars in page name (example - try to create page with _ char)
+ None of the icons visible on Win8.1 + Chrome
+ Opening ZeroWiki for the first time displays a huge number of messages "This page has been updated. Do you want to load the changes?"

Please report bugs in this section.

## Feature Requests

Please add feature requests here.
+ Localization for pages (example - we have [[Help]] page with default language (en) but if we add ?lang=$name you can get localized version)
+ upload content (images) but only as optional files
+  interface localization 
+ if 2 people editing page at the same time - show alert
+ Global 'recent changes' page
+ highlight difference between version when open history (like github)
+ protected pages
+ moderators
* creative commons license for easier (legal) modification of articles
+ anchor to elements
+ code element
* seperate ZeroWiki: sites from normal sites
* support [ [wikisite|alternative naming] ]
* Optional short user entered message for edits shown on the History page
* Talk page for each wiki page to keep discussions about edits off the articles
* More markdown elements support like quotes >, tables, etc

There definitely needs to be a standardized way of linking to ZeroNet sites. Relative linking works, but it indeed absolutely breaks the chrome extension. The other option is to simply build the URL depending on what the visitor's current URL is. It's not a simple 'a' tag and requires a bit of javascript magic, but certainly works. Kaffiene does something like this.

**ZeroNet** - *decentralized peer-to-peer network.*


ZeroNet uses Bitcoin cryptography and BitTorrent technology to build a decentralized censorship-resistant network.

Users can publish static or dynamic websites into ZeroNet and visitors automatically serve the visited website from their own PC, with the option to stop serving the website at any time by either pausing or deleting it. Websites will remain online even if it is being served by only one peer.

When a site is updated by its owner, all nodes serving that site (previous visitors) will receive only the incremental updates done to the site content.

ZeroNet comes with a built-in SQL database. This makes content-heavy site development easy. The DB is also synced with hosting nodes with incremental updates.

Pseudonymous like anonymous means information is not tied to your real name, your real identity, pseudonymous however means information is tied to a pseudonym, for example a username. The user Alice Smith might be posting in a forum under the username PokemonFan92, her posts are all tied to that specific username, but not to her real name Alice Smith.
